alert.note: Alert for Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 6:49PM EDT until May 06 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Whitley. In southeast Kentucky, Bell, Floyd, Harlan, Knott, Knox, Leslie, Letcher, Perry and Pike. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated another round of moderate rain moving in due to and area of showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 6 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whitesburg, Harlan, Pineville, Middlesboro, Letcher, Bath, Cumberland, Jenkins, Loyall, Evarts, Wheelwright, Fleming- Neon, Lynch, Pippa Passes, Benham, Vicco, Wallins Creek, Blackey, Pine Mountain and Big Laurel. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
